Text: O LORD, I call to You; hasten to me. Give ear to my voice when I call to You.
Context: David is urgently pleading for God’s attention in a time of need.

Text: May my prayer be set before You like incense, the raising of my hands like the evening offering.
Context: David likens his prayer to the pleasing scent of incense and his raised hands to the evening sacrifice, indicating reverence and submission.

Text: Set a guard, O LORD, over my mouth; keep watch at the door of my lips.
Context: David asks God to help him control his speech, to avoid sinning with his tongue.

Text: Do not let my heart incline to any evil thing, to practice wicked deeds with men who do iniquity; and do not let me eat of their delicacies.
Context: David is vigilant against temptation, asking God to steer his heart away from evil influences and the allurements of the wicked.

Text: Let a righteous man strike me—it is kindness; let him rebuke me—it is oil on my head. My head will not refuse it, for my prayer will still be against the deeds of the wicked.
Context: David expresses willingness to accept correction from the righteous, contrasting this with his stance against the wicked.

Polarity: Their rulers will be thrown off the cliffs, and the wicked will learn that my words were well spoken.
Context: Their rulers will be thrown off the cliffs, and the wicked will learn that my words were well spoken.
column7: David foresees the downfall of corrupt leaders and his eventual vindication.

Text: As when a plowman cleaves the earth, our bones have been scattered at the mouth of Sheol.
Context: The scattering of bones near the grave is an image reflecting the severity of their plight, perhaps in battle or persecution.

Text: But my eyes are fixed on You, O Sovereign LORD. In You I take refuge; do not leave my soul defenseless.
Context: Despite the danger, David remains focused on God, seeking His protection and affirming his trust in Him.

Text: Keep me from the snares they have set for me, from the traps of the workers of iniquity.
Context: David implores God to protect him from the hidden dangers laid by evildoers.

Text: Let the wicked fall into their own nets, while I pass by in safety.
Context: David expresses his hope that the wicked will be caught in their own traps, while he remains unharmed.
